Package com.metransfert.network

Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.metransfert.network.Packet
  • public class Packet
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates an array of binary data to send over the network. It allows for easy serlialisation in order to be sent over the network. (i.e automatic header creation)

    General Packet layout : 

     Packet layout : this describes the general layout of every packet.
<=========== HEADER ===========><==================PAYLOAD/DATA=======================>  
<================================ N bytes ============================================>  N = payload_len + header_len
+-----------------+------------+------------------------------------------------------+
| Int payload_len | Byte type  |                 Byte[] packet payload                |
+-----------------+------------+------------------------------------------------------+
<=====4 bytes=====><==1 byte==><=============== payload_len bytes ====================>
    Author:
    Alexandre

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static boolean canEncapsulate​(byte[] data)
      Checks whether the given data can be encapsulated into a Packet (i.e can data fit into a Packet (4 GB max with header)

      Returns a reference to the underlying data array (payload).
      java.nio.ByteBuffer getPayloadBuffer()
      Returns a read-only copy of the ByteBuffer wrapping the packet's payload. with index 0 The copied ByteBuffer index is 0.
      int getPayloadLength()

      Returns the type ID of the packet (see Documentation for existing packet types)

      • PACKETTYPE_FILE

        public static final byte PACKETTYPE_FILE
        Type ID of a file packet 
         File packet:
        ID : 1
        Direction : Client <---> Server
        Description : This packet will encapsulate file transfered between client and server (For uploads and downloads)
 
 'File' packet data layout : 
<============ payload_len bytes ==============> (N < 2^4)
+----------------+----------------------------+
| Str fileName   |        Byte[] data         |
+----------------+----------------------------+
<====n bytes=====><======= N-n bytes =========>
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Packet

        public Packet​(byte type,
              byte[] payload)
        Create a new packet of specified type with given payload.

        NOTE : The Packet does not copy the given data, it stores a reference. Modifying the array will cause the Packet to be modified and vice-versa

        Parameters:
        type - The type ID of the Packet
        payload - The useful data of the Packet (data minus header)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given payload is null

    • Method Detail

public void writeTo​(java.io.OutputStream stream)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated.
        Serializes and writes the Packet to the given OutputStream
        Parameters:
        stream -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the writing process threw an IOException
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given OutputStream is null

      • getType

        public byte getType()
        Returns the type ID of the packet (see Documentation for existing packet types)
        Returns:
        This packet's type ID

      • getPayloadLength

        public int getPayloadLength()
        Returns:
        the length (in bytes) of the encapsulated data (payload), that is the total length of the packet minus the header's length

      • getPayload

        public byte[] getPayload()
        Returns a reference to the underlying data array (payload). Modifying this array will modify the packet's data and vice-versa
        Returns:
        A reference to the packet's payload data

      • getPayloadBuffer

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer getPayloadBuffer()
        Returns a read-only copy of the ByteBuffer wrapping the packet's payload. with index 0 The copied ByteBuffer index is 0. NOTE : The data itself is not copied. Only the ByteBuffer wrapper object is
        Returns:
        The read-only copy of the ByteBuffer

      • canEncapsulate

        public static boolean canEncapsulate​(byte[] data)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks whether the given data can be encapsulated into a Packet (i.e can data fit into a Packet (4 GB max with header)
        Parameters:
        data - the data to test
        Returns:
        true if the data can be encapsulated into a Packet, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
